top_comment.text:
Me encantan tus vídeos! Yo tengo un conejo y necesito ayuda!!! Tengo 
algunas preguntas espero que me pueda ayudar.. Mi primera pregunta como se 
limpia las patitas del conejo si están sucios porque no le quiero bañar 
muchas veces, las patas de mi conejo están bien amarillos como los 
limpio... Segunda pregunta que se necesita para llevar a un conejo de 
viejo? Ósea tenía que pagar para llevarlo o sacarle un pasaporte ? O que se 
hace ayúdeme! Porque se callen las orejas a mi conejo? Y que hago para q 
baje de peso Y la última pregunta es que mi conejo en la pata derecha no 
tiene pelo ? Porque es eso ? Espero q me pueda ayudar por favor!! Muchas 
gracias sus vídeos me ayudan mucho!!! ﻿
top_comment.author: Cristina Guallpa

comments.text:
+Cristina Guallpa Hola Cristina, las patitas de un conejo siempre van a ser 
mas amarillas porque son como sus calcetines, camina por todos los sitios ( 
hasta en su propia orina) y se ensucian muy rapido. Ademas poco a poco 
cogen ese color amarillento. Si no quieres bañarlo, le puedes limpiar solo 
las patas con la ayuda de unos pañuelos humedos. En cuanto al tema de 
viajar, si vas en avion necesitara su cartilla sellada por el medico 
veterinario donde certifica que esta sano y tiene todas las vacunas al dia. 
Tambien necesitaras comprarle un transportin adecuado ( la compania aeria 
te dara las medidas) para poder subirlo al avion. Saludos!
comments.author: CyPmascota

captions.text: We have an english channel: Everything about your pet! Subscribe!
https://www.youtube.com/user/allaboutyourpet
We're going on holiday Roger.
We are going to do Barcelona-Málaga, that I hope will not take us more than
5 hours.
So I'm going to prepare your pet carrier, so you are comfortable
and nice.
So, in first place, first, first...
The Naturlitter,
the base filling. The most apropriate pet carrier, has to be more or less
the size of the pet. The dimensions are more or less like the
one I have here. A correct size pet carrier has to let the animal
move around, stand up
and be more or less comfortable. It doesn't have to be too big either,
not because its bigger
it will be better, no way. The big pet carriers can tilt
when moving it, and are not safe for small pets as they are
unstable. So it must not be very big, only the enough size
so the animal is comfortable. Something logical.
Right, first fill in the Naturlitter inside.
It is a bedding base made from old newspapers, that helps to
avoid sliding.
Right, we will fill the base generously...
Let see...
Aproximately..
two or three centimeters.
Once filled in with Naturlitter, the second thing
I will use is called Sweet Dreams.
It is a bedding made of cotton and I will use it to make a
type of bed
at the back of the pet carrier.
I have one open here so you can see how much I
amb going to use...
Well this bedding
is like a cotton and is used for the bed.
Naturlitter will be the floor bedding ahd this will do the bed or nest
for the animal. It is slightly more comfortable and warmer..
And finally
I will use hay. Hay has two fuctions,
The first and most important is to hide the animal. It helps to avoid
principally the stress.
because it is like an artifitial nest where the animal can
camouflage and feels safe.
It can also be used as food, because the animal will
eat it.
Roger, Come on! Get out! You're eager to go on holiday aren't you!
Wait a minute, we have to prepare your house first.
Here the hay as much as we like, so they can
hide in it
and if he's hungry then eat too...
Right I've got the three tings ready, now all I have to do is simply
add the food.
Baby food, not much, becuase probably the animal will not eat much
or maybe nothing, we will just put some just in case he is hungry
and the smell of food calms them.
We will put a little hand full here in the front...
Good, and now water.
As I normally put the water onthe door, what I will do is
put Roger inside,
come on my friend, there you go.
I close the pet carrier...
And the water goes on the door..
Be careful with the water,because if this bottle
moves too much,
it is possible that it empties. like you can see here.
In other words, if its going to be a bumpy journey,
the best to do is not give the animal water because it will soak the animal.
Then it would be better to stop now and then and give him the water directly.
If its going to be a calm journey, for example, I will travel in a high speed train, then
great, as there is hardly no movement, so I will leave him the water bottle.
I will place it on the pet carrier,
and fix it with the wire.
It goes like this, and if it doesn't move, then it will not leak
and he will have drinking water whenever he wants to.
It is a very good idea that
a few days before travelling, you place your pet
inside the pet carrier during the night, so
they can get used to it, and recognize the pet carrier, so its not something new
that he knows where his food is, knows where is the water, and somehow
he doesn't have a surprise when you place your pet inside the pet carrier. So this is the best way to
prepare a pet carrier.
and is ideal for a journy that will last more or less 5 hours
or even less.

title: CONEJOS - Cómo viajar con mi mascota
